name: Old Bull Moose
description: "Old Bull Moose" pays homage to Theodore Roosevelt, a man of questionable politics from a era of questionable politics. He was, however, educated, principled, strong, and dedicated. This poem reflects on the legacy of conservatism that only soft men, queer people, women and trans people seem to uphold - that kind of conservatism that looks to preserve the world, rather than the narrow interests of a party or people. Of course, 26 was a servant of the state, but he understood that he might be damned and that people of different creeds, races, and ideologies may, indeed, be better as warriors, thinkers, and human beings than he might be.
